meanings.sent1: She reproved his behavior at the party.
meanings.sent2: The teacher reproved the student for not completing the assignment.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave a reproachful look when it saw the empty food bowl.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds reproached the sunny sky for hiding behind them.
meanings.sent5: Her stern gaze was a clear reproach to his careless actions.

meanings.definition: A reproduction, especially of a work of art.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed a beautiful repro of the famous painting.
meanings.sent2: She bought a high-quality repro of the classic sculpture for her home.
meanings.sent3: The art student made a tiny repro of the Mona Lisa using clay.
meanings.sent4: The digital repro of the ancient manuscript was so detailed it looked real.
meanings.sent5: The artist's skillful repro captured the essence of the original masterpiece.

meanings.sent1: He received a stern repro from his boss for being late to work.
meanings.sent2: The child's parents gave him a gentle repro for not cleaning his room.
meanings.sent3: The dog's sad eyes seemed to be asking for a repro for chewing the shoes.
meanings.sent4: The wind whispered a repro to the leaves for falling too soon.
meanings.sent5: The disappointed look on her face was a silent repro for his thoughtless words.
